content.title: CogNet | MIT Press
content.description: MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it is an indispensable resource for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind.

<style>

<h1>Welcome to MIT CogNet</h1>
<p>If your institution already has access to MIT CogNet, you can access the content directly through your library’s catalog or <a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1&f_ContentType=Book" target="_blank">browse books</a> and journals in the collection.</p>
<h3>Foundational and cutting-edge content</h3>
<p>
MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it has been an indispensable resource since its inception in 2000, with new resources added each year for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind.
</p>
<p>
"MIT CogNet is an invaluable resource for all cognitive science research. It provides one-stop access to the best in both reference material and cutting-edge research, and is my starting point for every new project."<br>
<strong>—David Danks, Professor of Philosophy & Psychology, Carnegie Mellon University</strong>
</p>
<h2>Features</h2>
<h3>Reference works</h3>
<p>MIT CogNet offers the complete text of major cognitive science reference works published by the MIT Press, including several foundational works in the field. MIT CogNet also offers previous editions of reference works, many of which contain unique material.</p>
<h4>Full-text content of 18 core reference works include:</h4>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5456/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences" target="_blank"><em>The Cognitive Neurosciences, 6th Edition</em></a> edited by David Poeppel, George R. Mangun, and Michael S. Gazzaniga</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5525/The-Handbook-of-Rationality" target="_blank"><em>The Handbook of Rationality</em></a> edited by Markus Knauff and Wolfgang Spohn</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5443/Human-LanguageFrom-Genes-and-Brains-to-Behavior" target="_blank"><em>Human Language: From Genes and Brains to Behavior</em></a> edited by Peter Hagoort</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5444/Handbook-of-Embodied-Cognition-and-Sport" target="_blank"><em>Handbook of Embodied Cognition and Sport Psychology</em></a> edited by Massimiliano L. Cappuccio</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5417/Open-MIND-2-vol-setPhilosophy-and-the-Mind" target="_blank"><em>Open MIND: Philosophy and the Mind Sciences in the 21st Century, Volumes 1 and 2</em></a> edited by Thomas Metzinger and Jennifer M. Windt</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/4071/The-Handbook-of-Attention" target="_blank"><em>The Handbook of Attention</em></a> edited by Jonathan Fawcett, Evan Risko, and Alan Kingstone</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5454/The-New-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processing" target="_blank"><em>The New Handbook of Multisensory Processing</em></a> edited by Barry E. Stein</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5455/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences" target="_blank">The Cognitive Neurosciences, 5th edition</a></em> edited by Michael S. Gazzaniga, George R. Mangun</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3920/Eye-Retina-and-Visual-System-of-the-Mouse" target="_blank">Eye, Retina, and Visual System of the Mouse</a></em> edited by Leo M. Chalupa and Robert W. Williams</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3929/Handbook-of-Developmental-Cognitive-Neuroscience" target="_blank">Handbook of Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 2nd edition</a></em> edited by Charles A. Nelson and Monica Luciana</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3908/Principles-and-Practice-of-Clinical" target="_blank">Principles and Practice of Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision, 2nd edition</a></em> edited by John R. Heckenlively and Geoffrey B. Arden</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5424/The-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processes" target="_blank">The Handbook of Multisensory Processes</a></em> edited by Gemma A. Calvert, Charles Spence, and Barry E. Stein</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5395/The-Visual-Neurosciences-2-vol-set" target="_blank">The Visual Neurosciences, Volumes 1 and 2</a></em> edited by Leo M. Chalupa and John S. Werner</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5451/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-Communication-Disorders" target="_blank">The MIT Encyclopedia of Communication Disorders</a></em> edited by Raymond D. Kent</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/4358/The-Handbook-of-Brain-Theory-and-Neural-Networks" target="_blank">The Handbook of Brain Theory and Neural Networks, 2nd edition</a></em> edited by Michael A. Arbib</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5430/Culturing-Nerve-Cells" target="_blank">Culturing Nerve Cells, 2nd Edition</a></em> edited by Gary Banker and Kimberly Goslin</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5452/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-the-Cognitive-Sciences" target="_blank">The MIT Encyclopedia of the Cognitive Sciences</a></em> edited by Robert A. Wilson and Frank C. Keil</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3941/Artificial-LifeAn-Overview" target="_blank">Artificial Life: An Overview</a></em> edited by Christopher G. Langton</li>
</ul>
<h3>Books</h3>
<p>The full text of more than 900 books published by the MIT Press are included in MIT CogNet. New content is added on an ongoing and regular basis.</p>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Cognitive Science</a></button>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=22&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Neuroscience</a></button>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=56&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Psychology</a></button>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=20&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Linguistics and Language</a></button>
<h3>Journals</h3>
<p>MIT CogNet provides access to the full text of 9 MIT Press journals with 1,194 issues. These journals form the core of the MIT Press Journals science and technology publishing program. Included are:</p>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/artl" target="_blank"><em>Artificial Life</em></a></li>

<p>Free 30-day trials of MIT CogNet are available to institutions. Individuals affiliated with an institution should talk to their librarian about requesting trial access. Welcome to MIT CogNet

If your institution already has access to MIT CogNet, you can access the content directly through your library’s catalog or browse books and journals in the collection.

Foundational and cutting-edge content

MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it has been an indispensable resource since its inception in 2000, with new resources added each year for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind.

"MIT CogNet is an invaluable resource for all cognitive science research. It provides one-stop access to the best in both reference material and cutting-edge research, and is my starting point for every new project." —David Danks, Professor of Philosophy & Psychology, Carnegie Mellon University

Features

Reference works

MIT CogNet offers the complete text of major cognitive science reference works published by the MIT Press, including several foundational works in the field. MIT CogNet also offers previous editions of reference works, many of which contain unique material.

Full-text content of 18 core reference works include:

  • The Cognitive Neurosciences, 6th Edition edited by David Poeppel, George R. Mangun, and Michael S. Gazzaniga
  • The Handbook of Rationality edited by Markus Knauff and Wolfgang Spohn
  • Human Language: From Genes and Brains to Behavior edited by Peter Hagoort
  • Handbook of Embodied Cognition and Sport Psychology edited by Massimiliano L. Cappuccio
  • Open MIND: Philosophy and the Mind Sciences in the 21st Century, Volumes 1 and 2 edited by Thomas Metzinger and Jennifer M. Windt
  • The Handbook of Attention edited by Jonathan Fawcett, Evan Risko, and Alan Kingstone
  • The New Handbook of Multisensory Processing edited by Barry E. Stein
  • The Cognitive Neurosciences, 5th edition edited by Michael S. Gazzaniga, George R. Mangun
  • Eye, Retina, and Visual System of the Mouse edited by Leo M. Chalupa and Robert W. Williams
  • Handbook of Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 2nd edition edited by Charles A. Nelson and Monica Luciana
  • Principles and Practice of Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision, 2nd edition edited by John R. Heckenlively and Geoffrey B. Arden
  • The Handbook of Multisensory Processes edited by Gemma A. Calvert, Charles Spence, and Barry E. Stein
  • The Visual Neurosciences, Volumes 1 and 2 edited by Leo M. Chalupa and John S. Werner
  • The MIT Encyclopedia of Communication Disorders edited by Raymond D. Kent
  • The Handbook of Brain Theory and Neural Networks, 2nd edition edited by Michael A. Arbib
  • Culturing Nerve Cells, 2nd Edition edited by Gary Banker and Kimberly Goslin
  • The MIT Encyclopedia of the Cognitive Sciences edited by Robert A. Wilson and Frank C. Keil
  • Artificial Life: An Overview edited by Christopher G. Langton

Books

The full text of more than 900 books published by the MIT Press are included in MIT CogNet. New content is added on an ongoing and regular basis.

Journals

MIT CogNet provides access to the full text of 9 MIT Press journals with 1,194 issues. These journals form the core of the MIT Press Journals science and technology publishing program. Included are:

  • Artificial Life
  • Computational Linguistics
  • Evolutionary Computation
  • Imaging Neuroscience
  • Journal of Cognitive Neuroscience
  • Linguistic Inquiry
  • Network Neuroscience
  • Neural Computation
  • Open Mind: Discoveries in Cognitive Science 

Start Your Free Trial

Free 30-day trials of MIT CogNet are available to institutions. Individuals affiliated with an institution should talk to their librarian about requesting trial access. Independent researchers have the option to subscribe directly to MIT CogNet for three months, six months, or one year. .

# Welcome to MIT CogNet
If your institution already has access to MIT CogNet, you can access the content directly through your library’s catalog or [browse books](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1&f_ContentType=Book) and journals in the collection.
### Foundational and cutting-edge content
MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it has been an indispensable resource since its inception in 2000, with new resources added each year for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind. 
"MIT CogNet is an invaluable resource for all cognitive science research. It provides one-stop access to the best in both reference material and cutting-edge research, and is my starting point for every new project." **—David Danks, Professor of Philosophy & Psychology, Carnegie Mellon University**
## Features
### Reference works
MIT CogNet offers the complete text of major cognitive science reference works published by the MIT Press, including several foundational works in the field. MIT CogNet also offers previous editions of reference works, many of which contain unique material.
#### Full-text content of 18 core reference works include:
  * [_The Cognitive Neurosciences, 6th Edition_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5456/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences) edited by David Poeppel, George R. Mangun, and Michael S. Gazzaniga
  * [_The Handbook of Rationality_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5525/The-Handbook-of-Rationality) edited by Markus Knauff and Wolfgang Spohn
  * [_Human Language: From Genes and Brains to Behavior_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5443/Human-LanguageFrom-Genes-and-Brains-to-Behavior) edited by Peter Hagoort
  * [_Handbook of Embodied Cognition and Sport Psychology_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5444/Handbook-of-Embodied-Cognition-and-Sport) edited by Massimiliano L. Cappuccio
  * [_Open MIND: Philosophy and the Mind Sciences in the 21st Century, Volumes 1 and 2_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5417/Open-MIND-2-vol-setPhilosophy-and-the-Mind) edited by Thomas Metzinger and Jennifer M. Windt
  * [_The Handbook of Attention_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/4071/The-Handbook-of-Attention) edited by Jonathan Fawcett, Evan Risko, and Alan Kingstone
  * [_The New Handbook of Multisensory Processing_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5454/The-New-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processing) edited by Barry E. Stein
  * _[The Cognitive Neurosciences, 5th edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5455/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences)_ edited by Michael S. Gazzaniga, George R. Mangun
  * _[Eye, Retina, and Visual System of the Mouse](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3920/Eye-Retina-and-Visual-System-of-the-Mouse)_ edited by Leo M. Chalupa and Robert W. Williams
  * _[Handbook of Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3929/Handbook-of-Developmental-Cognitive-Neuroscience)_ edited by Charles A. Nelson and Monica Luciana
  * _[Principles and Practice of Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3908/Principles-and-Practice-of-Clinical)_ edited by John R. Heckenlively and Geoffrey B. Arden
  * _[The Handbook of Multisensory Processes](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5424/The-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processes)_ edited by Gemma A. Calvert, Charles Spence, and Barry E. Stein
  * _[The Visual Neurosciences, Volumes 1 and 2](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5395/The-Visual-Neurosciences-2-vol-set)_ edited by Leo M. Chalupa and John S. Werner
  * _[The MIT Encyclopedia of Communication Disorders](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5451/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-Communication-Disorders)_ edited by Raymond D. Kent
  * _[The Handbook of Brain Theory and Neural Networks, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/4358/The-Handbook-of-Brain-Theory-and-Neural-Networks)_ edited by Michael A. Arbib
  * _[Culturing Nerve Cells, 2nd Edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5430/Culturing-Nerve-Cells)_ edited by Gary Banker and Kimberly Goslin
  * _[The MIT Encyclopedia of the Cognitive Sciences](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5452/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-the-Cognitive-Sciences)_ edited by Robert A. Wilson and Frank C. Keil
  * _[Artificial Life: An Overview](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3941/Artificial-LifeAn-Overview)_ edited by Christopher G. Langton


### Books
The full text of more than 900 books published by the MIT Press are included in MIT CogNet. New content is added on an ongoing and regular basis.
[Books in Cognitive Science](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1) [Books in Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=22&fl_SiteID=1&page=1) [Books in Psychology](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=56&fl_SiteID=1&page=1) [Books in Linguistics and Language](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=20&fl_SiteID=1&page=1)
### Journals
MIT CogNet provides access to the full text of 9 MIT Press journals with 1,194 issues. These journals form the core of the MIT Press Journals science and technology publishing program. Included are:
  * [_Artificial Life_](https://direct.mit.edu/artl)
  * _[Computational Linguistics](https://direct.mit.edu/coli)_
  * _[Evolutionary Computation](https://direct.mit.edu/evco)_
  * _[Imaging Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/imag)_
  * _[Journal of Cognitive Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/jocn)_
  * _[Linguistic Inquiry](https://direct.mit.edu/ling)_
  * _[Network Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/netn)_
  * _[Neural Computation](https://direct.mit.edu/neco)_
  * [_Open Mind: Discoveries in Cognitive Science_](https://direct.mit.edu/opmi)


## Start Your Free Trial
Free 30-day trials of MIT CogNet are available to institutions. Individuals affiliated with an institution should talk to their librarian about requesting trial access. Independent researchers have the option to subscribe directly to MIT CogNet for three months, six months, or one year. .

<h1>Welcome to MIT CogNet</h1>
<p>If your institution already has access to MIT CogNet, you can access the content directly through your library’s catalog or <a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1&f_ContentType=Book" target="_blank">browse books</a> and journals in the collection.</p>
<h3>Foundational and cutting-edge content</h3>
<p>
MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it has been an indispensable resource since its inception in 2000, with new resources added each year for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind.
</p>
<p>
"MIT CogNet is an invaluable resource for all cognitive science research. It provides one-stop access to the best in both reference material and cutting-edge research, and is my starting point for every new project."<br>
<strong>—David Danks, Professor of Philosophy & Psychology, Carnegie Mellon University</strong>
</p>
<h2>Features</h2>
<h3>Reference works</h3>
<p>MIT CogNet offers the complete text of major cognitive science reference works published by the MIT Press, including several foundational works in the field. MIT CogNet also offers previous editions of reference works, many of which contain unique material.</p>
<h4>Full-text content of 18 core reference works include:</h4>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5456/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences" target="_blank"><em>The Cognitive Neurosciences, 6th Edition</em></a> edited by David Poeppel, George R. Mangun, and Michael S. Gazzaniga</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5525/The-Handbook-of-Rationality" target="_blank"><em>The Handbook of Rationality</em></a> edited by Markus Knauff and Wolfgang Spohn</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5443/Human-LanguageFrom-Genes-and-Brains-to-Behavior" target="_blank"><em>Human Language: From Genes and Brains to Behavior</em></a> edited by Peter Hagoort</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5444/Handbook-of-Embodied-Cognition-and-Sport" target="_blank"><em>Handbook of Embodied Cognition and Sport Psychology</em></a> edited by Massimiliano L. Cappuccio</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5417/Open-MIND-2-vol-setPhilosophy-and-the-Mind" target="_blank"><em>Open MIND: Philosophy and the Mind Sciences in the 21st Century, Volumes 1 and 2</em></a> edited by Thomas Metzinger and Jennifer M. Windt</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/4071/The-Handbook-of-Attention" target="_blank"><em>The Handbook of Attention</em></a> edited by Jonathan Fawcett, Evan Risko, and Alan Kingstone</li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5454/The-New-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processing" target="_blank"><em>The New Handbook of Multisensory Processing</em></a> edited by Barry E. Stein</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5455/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences" target="_blank">The Cognitive Neurosciences, 5th edition</a></em> edited by Michael S. Gazzaniga, George R. Mangun</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3920/Eye-Retina-and-Visual-System-of-the-Mouse" target="_blank">Eye, Retina, and Visual System of the Mouse</a></em> edited by Leo M. Chalupa and Robert W. Williams</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3929/Handbook-of-Developmental-Cognitive-Neuroscience" target="_blank">Handbook of Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 2nd edition</a></em> edited by Charles A. Nelson and Monica Luciana</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3908/Principles-and-Practice-of-Clinical" target="_blank">Principles and Practice of Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision, 2nd edition</a></em> edited by John R. Heckenlively and Geoffrey B. Arden</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5424/The-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processes" target="_blank">The Handbook of Multisensory Processes</a></em> edited by Gemma A. Calvert, Charles Spence, and Barry E. Stein</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5395/The-Visual-Neurosciences-2-vol-set" target="_blank">The Visual Neurosciences, Volumes 1 and 2</a></em> edited by Leo M. Chalupa and John S. Werner</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5451/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-Communication-Disorders" target="_blank">The MIT Encyclopedia of Communication Disorders</a></em> edited by Raymond D. Kent</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/4358/The-Handbook-of-Brain-Theory-and-Neural-Networks" target="_blank">The Handbook of Brain Theory and Neural Networks, 2nd edition</a></em> edited by Michael A. Arbib</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5430/Culturing-Nerve-Cells" target="_blank">Culturing Nerve Cells, 2nd Edition</a></em> edited by Gary Banker and Kimberly Goslin</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5452/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-the-Cognitive-Sciences" target="_blank">The MIT Encyclopedia of the Cognitive Sciences</a></em> edited by Robert A. Wilson and Frank C. Keil</li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3941/Artificial-LifeAn-Overview" target="_blank">Artificial Life: An Overview</a></em> edited by Christopher G. Langton</li>
</ul>
<h3>Books</h3>
<p>The full text of more than 900 books published by the MIT Press are included in MIT CogNet. New content is added on an ongoing and regular basis.</p>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Cognitive Science</a></button>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=22&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Neuroscience</a></button>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=56&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Psychology</a></button>
<button class="button button1"><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=20&fl_SiteID=1&page=1" target="_blank">Books in Linguistics and Language</a></button>
<h3>Journals</h3>
<p>MIT CogNet provides access to the full text of 9 MIT Press journals with 1,194 issues. These journals form the core of the MIT Press Journals science and technology publishing program. Included are:</p>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/artl" target="_blank"><em>Artificial Life</em></a></li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/coli" target="_blank">Computational Linguistics</a></em></li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/evco" target="_blank">Evolutionary Computation</a></em></li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/imag" target="_blank">Imaging Neuroscience</a></em></li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/jocn" target="_blank">Journal of Cognitive Neuroscience</a></em></li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/ling" target="_blank">Linguistic Inquiry</a></em></li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/netn" target="_blank">Network Neuroscience</a></em></li>
    <li><em><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/neco" target="_blank">Neural Computation</a></em></li>
    <li><a href="https://direct.mit.edu/opmi" target="_blank"><em>Open Mind: Discoveries in Cognitive Science</em></a> </li>
</ul>
<h2>Start Your Free Trial</h2>
<p>Free 30-day trials of MIT CogNet are available to institutions. Individuals affiliated with an institution should talk to their librarian about requesting trial access. Independent researchers have the option to subscribe directly to MIT CogNet for three months, six months, or one year. <a href="https://mitpress.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/3/group/-1" target="_blank">Please contact us for pricing</a>.</p>
<a class="button" href="https://mitpress.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/3/create/134" target="_blank">Request a free trial</a>

Welcome to MIT CogNet

If your institution already has access to MIT CogNet, you can access the content directly through your library’s catalog or browse books and journals in the collection.

Foundational and cutting-edge content

MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it has been an indispensable resource since its inception in 2000, with new resources added each year for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind.

"MIT CogNet is an invaluable resource for all cognitive science research. It provides one-stop access to the best in both reference material and cutting-edge research, and is my starting point for every new project." —David Danks, Professor of Philosophy & Psychology, Carnegie Mellon University

Features

Reference works

MIT CogNet offers the complete text of major cognitive science reference works published by the MIT Press, including several foundational works in the field. MIT CogNet also offers previous editions of reference works, many of which contain unique material.

Full-text content of 18 core reference works include:

  • The Cognitive Neurosciences, 6th Edition edited by David Poeppel, George R. Mangun, and Michael S. Gazzaniga
  • The Handbook of Rationality edited by Markus Knauff and Wolfgang Spohn
  • Human Language: From Genes and Brains to Behavior edited by Peter Hagoort
  • Handbook of Embodied Cognition and Sport Psychology edited by Massimiliano L. Cappuccio
  • Open MIND: Philosophy and the Mind Sciences in the 21st Century, Volumes 1 and 2 edited by Thomas Metzinger and Jennifer M. Windt
  • The Handbook of Attention edited by Jonathan Fawcett, Evan Risko, and Alan Kingstone
  • The New Handbook of Multisensory Processing edited by Barry E. Stein
  • The Cognitive Neurosciences, 5th edition edited by Michael S. Gazzaniga, George R. Mangun
  • Eye, Retina, and Visual System of the Mouse edited by Leo M. Chalupa and Robert W. Williams
  • Handbook of Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 2nd edition edited by Charles A. Nelson and Monica Luciana
  • Principles and Practice of Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision, 2nd edition edited by John R. Heckenlively and Geoffrey B. Arden
  • The Handbook of Multisensory Processes edited by Gemma A. Calvert, Charles Spence, and Barry E. Stein
  • The Visual Neurosciences, Volumes 1 and 2 edited by Leo M. Chalupa and John S. Werner
  • The MIT Encyclopedia of Communication Disorders edited by Raymond D. Kent
  • The Handbook of Brain Theory and Neural Networks, 2nd edition edited by Michael A. Arbib
  • Culturing Nerve Cells, 2nd Edition edited by Gary Banker and Kimberly Goslin
  • The MIT Encyclopedia of the Cognitive Sciences edited by Robert A. Wilson and Frank C. Keil
  • Artificial Life: An Overview edited by Christopher G. Langton

Books

The full text of more than 900 books published by the MIT Press are included in MIT CogNet. New content is added on an ongoing and regular basis.

Journals

MIT CogNet provides access to the full text of 9 MIT Press journals with 1,194 issues. These journals form the core of the MIT Press Journals science and technology publishing program. Included are:

  • Artificial Life
  • Computational Linguistics
  • Evolutionary Computation
  • Imaging Neuroscience
  • Journal of Cognitive Neuroscience
  • Linguistic Inquiry
  • Network Neuroscience
  • Neural Computation
  • Open Mind: Discoveries in Cognitive Science 

Start Your Free Trial

Free 30-day trials of MIT CogNet are available to institutions. Individuals affiliated with an institution should talk to their librarian about requesting trial access. Independent researchers have the option to subscribe directly to MIT CogNet for three months, six months, or one year. .

Visit our librarians page for:

  • General information
  • Title lists
  • MARC records
  • KBART files

# Welcome to MIT CogNet

### Foundational and cutting-edge content
MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it has been an indispensable resource since its inception in 2000, with new resources added each year for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind. 
"MIT CogNet is an invaluable resource for all cognitive science research. It provides one-stop access to the best in both reference material and cutting-edge research, and is my starting point for every new project." **—David Danks, Professor of Philosophy & Psychology, Carnegie Mellon University**
## Features
### Reference works
MIT CogNet offers the complete text of major cognitive science reference works published by the MIT Press, including several foundational works in the field. MIT CogNet also offers previous editions of reference works, many of which contain unique material.
#### Full-text content of 18 core reference works include:
  * [_The Cognitive Neurosciences, 6th Edition_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5456/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences) edited by David Poeppel, George R. Mangun, and Michael S. Gazzaniga

  * [_The Handbook of Attention_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/4071/The-Handbook-of-Attention) edited by Jonathan Fawcett, Evan Risko, and Alan Kingstone
  * [_The New Handbook of Multisensory Processing_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5454/The-New-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processing) edited by Barry E. Stein
  * _[The Cognitive Neurosciences, 5th edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5455/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences)_ edited by Michael S. Gazzaniga, George R. Mangun

  * _[Handbook of Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3929/Handbook-of-Developmental-Cognitive-Neuroscience)_ edited by Charles A. Nelson and Monica Luciana
  * _[Principles and Practice of Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3908/Principles-and-Practice-of-Clinical)_ edited by John R. Heckenlively and Geoffrey B. Arden
  * _[The Handbook of Multisensory Processes](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5424/The-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processes)_ edited by Gemma A. Calvert, Charles Spence, and Barry E. Stein
  * _[The Visual Neurosciences, Volumes 1 and 2](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5395/The-Visual-Neurosciences-2-vol-set)_ edited by Leo M. Chalupa and John S. Werner
  * _[The MIT Encyclopedia of Communication Disorders](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5451/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-Communication-Disorders)_ edited by Raymond D. Kent
  * _[The Handbook of Brain Theory and Neural Networks, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/4358/The-Handbook-of-Brain-Theory-and-Neural-Networks)_ edited by Michael A. Arbib

The full text of more than 900 books published by the MIT Press are included in MIT CogNet. New content is added on an ongoing and regular basis.

# Welcome to MIT CogNet
If your institution already has access to MIT CogNet, you can access the content directly through your library’s catalog or [browse books](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1&f_ContentType=Book) and journals in the collection.
### Foundational and cutting-edge content
MIT CogNet is the essential research tool for scholars in the brain and cognitive sciences. Authoritative and unrivaled, it has been an indispensable resource since its inception in 2000, with new resources added each year for those interested in cutting-edge primary research across the range of fields that study the nature of the human mind. 
"MIT CogNet is an invaluable resource for all cognitive science research. It provides one-stop access to the best in both reference material and cutting-edge research, and is my starting point for every new project." **—David Danks, Professor of Philosophy & Psychology, Carnegie Mellon University**
## Features
### Reference works
MIT CogNet offers the complete text of major cognitive science reference works published by the MIT Press, including several foundational works in the field. MIT CogNet also offers previous editions of reference works, many of which contain unique material.
#### Full-text content of 18 core reference works include:
  * [_The Cognitive Neurosciences, 6th Edition_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5456/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences) edited by David Poeppel, George R. Mangun, and Michael S. Gazzaniga
  * [_The Handbook of Rationality_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5525/The-Handbook-of-Rationality) edited by Markus Knauff and Wolfgang Spohn
  * [_Human Language: From Genes and Brains to Behavior_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5443/Human-LanguageFrom-Genes-and-Brains-to-Behavior) edited by Peter Hagoort
  * [_Handbook of Embodied Cognition and Sport Psychology_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5444/Handbook-of-Embodied-Cognition-and-Sport) edited by Massimiliano L. Cappuccio
  * [_Open MIND: Philosophy and the Mind Sciences in the 21st Century, Volumes 1 and 2_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5417/Open-MIND-2-vol-setPhilosophy-and-the-Mind) edited by Thomas Metzinger and Jennifer M. Windt
  * [_The Handbook of Attention_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/4071/The-Handbook-of-Attention) edited by Jonathan Fawcett, Evan Risko, and Alan Kingstone
  * [_The New Handbook of Multisensory Processing_](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5454/The-New-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processing) edited by Barry E. Stein
  * _[The Cognitive Neurosciences, 5th edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5455/The-Cognitive-Neurosciences)_ edited by Michael S. Gazzaniga, George R. Mangun
  * _[Eye, Retina, and Visual System of the Mouse](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3920/Eye-Retina-and-Visual-System-of-the-Mouse)_ edited by Leo M. Chalupa and Robert W. Williams
  * _[Handbook of Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3929/Handbook-of-Developmental-Cognitive-Neuroscience)_ edited by Charles A. Nelson and Monica Luciana
  * _[Principles and Practice of Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/3908/Principles-and-Practice-of-Clinical)_ edited by John R. Heckenlively and Geoffrey B. Arden
  * _[The Handbook of Multisensory Processes](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5424/The-Handbook-of-Multisensory-Processes)_ edited by Gemma A. Calvert, Charles Spence, and Barry E. Stein
  * _[The Visual Neurosciences, Volumes 1 and 2](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5395/The-Visual-Neurosciences-2-vol-set)_ edited by Leo M. Chalupa and John S. Werner
  * _[The MIT Encyclopedia of Communication Disorders](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/5451/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-Communication-Disorders)_ edited by Raymond D. Kent
  * _[The Handbook of Brain Theory and Neural Networks, 2nd edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/book/4358/The-Handbook-of-Brain-Theory-and-Neural-Networks)_ edited by Michael A. Arbib
  * _[Culturing Nerve Cells, 2nd Edition](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5430/Culturing-Nerve-Cells)_ edited by Gary Banker and Kimberly Goslin
  * _[The MIT Encyclopedia of the Cognitive Sciences](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/5452/The-MIT-Encyclopedia-of-the-Cognitive-Sciences)_ edited by Robert A. Wilson and Frank C. Keil
  * _[Artificial Life: An Overview](https://direct.mit.edu/books/edited-volume/3941/Artificial-LifeAn-Overview)_ edited by Christopher G. Langton


### Books
The full text of more than 900 books published by the MIT Press are included in MIT CogNet. New content is added on an ongoing and regular basis.
[Books in Cognitive Science](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=8&fl_SiteID=1&page=1) [Books in Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=22&fl_SiteID=1&page=1) [Books in Psychology](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=56&fl_SiteID=1&page=1) [Books in Linguistics and Language](https://direct.mit.edu/search-results?q=*&hd=advancedAny&f_ContentType=Book&f_FacetCategoryIDs_1=20&fl_SiteID=1&page=1)
### Journals
MIT CogNet provides access to the full text of 9 MIT Press journals with 1,194 issues. These journals form the core of the MIT Press Journals science and technology publishing program. Included are:
  * [_Artificial Life_](https://direct.mit.edu/artl)
  * _[Computational Linguistics](https://direct.mit.edu/coli)_
  * _[Evolutionary Computation](https://direct.mit.edu/evco)_
  * _[Imaging Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/imag)_
  * _[Journal of Cognitive Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/jocn)_
  * _[Linguistic Inquiry](https://direct.mit.edu/ling)_
  * _[Network Neuroscience](https://direct.mit.edu/netn)_
  * _[Neural Computation](https://direct.mit.edu/neco)_
  * [_Open Mind: Discoveries in Cognitive Science_](https://direct.mit.edu/opmi)


## Start Your Free Trial
Free 30-day trials of MIT CogNet are available to institutions. Individuals affiliated with an institution should talk to their librarian about requesting trial access. Independent researchers have the option to subscribe directly to MIT CogNet for three months, six months, or one year. .
